column4: question
Were underwriter instructions acted on correctly?
Was the transaction within the user’s authority? If not, were appropriate approvals obtained?
When the processor took control of the case, was it handled in an appropriate amount of time?
Were related cases with earlier effective dates escalated prior to renewal prep?
Was the master drivers list updated correctly?
Were the necessary MVRS ordered or entered manually?
Was the underwriter advised of any driver concerns?
Was the premium and loss record completed correctly?
Was the renewal WIP/renewal GarageRater prepped as per underwriter instruction?
Were the 43/43A endorsements updated as per provincial standards?
Was the CVOR/OMVIC registration status checked?
Was the underwriter notified of any open abeyances?
Were any cross reference policies noted appropriately?
Was appropriate full documentation added describing the transaction?
Were underwriter instructions acted on correctly?
Was the transaction within the user’s authority? If not, were appropriate approvals obtained?
When the processor took control of the case, was it handled in an appropriate amount of time?
Were related cases with earlier effective dates escalated prior to renewal issuance?
Was the renewal issued at the correct annual premium?
Was the renewal issued on the correct payment plan?
Have all endorsements been created correctly?
Was the WIP issued correctly? Was coding in ENTR completed correctly?
Was an email sent and abeyance set for any outstanding information/documentation?
Were all policy documents uploaded correctly to SharePoint (using proper naming conventions)?
Were all appropriate policy documents and liability certificates sent to document delivery?
Were prints ordered appropriately?
Was the case sent to document delivery using the correct document generation status?
Was appropriate full documentation added describing the transaction?
Were broker/underwriter instructions acted on correctly?
Was the transaction within the user’s authority? If not, were appropriate approvals obtained?
When the processor took control of the case, was it handled in an appropriate amount of time?
Were MVRS ordered or entered manually?
Were appropriate driver concerns referred to the underwriter?
Were any appropriate surcharges/adjustments added/removed correctly in PAS?
Was the drivers list updated correctly?
Was the broker notified appropriately?
Were the appropriate referrals made to the underwriter?
Was the data entered correctly into PAS (vehicle model, VIN, named insured, territory, rate group, named insured, address)?
Were the appropriate endorsements added and premiums charged?
Was the appropriate coverage added or removed?
Were all interests shown appropriately on the policy?
Were related cases processed in their respective order of effective dates?
Was the WIP issued correctly? Was coding in ENTR completed correctly?
Was the 25A/72 filled out correctly?

Were all appropriate endorsements and liability certificates sent to document delivery?
Were any necessary registered letters sent to additional interests?
Were prints ordered appropriately?
Was the case sent to document delivery using the correct document generation status?
Was appropriate full documentation added describing the transaction?

When the processor took control of the case, was it handled in an appropriate amount of time?
Has the master drivers list been created?
Have MVRS been ordered or entered manually?
Was the underwriter advised of any driver concerns prior to issuing the policy?
Do the lessors or lienholders align with the correct endorsements?
Do the VINs in the policy match the VINS on the ownerships (if ownerships have been received)?
Was the policy issued at the correct annual premium?
Was the PAC/Direct Bill account created correctly?
Was the policy issued on the correct payment plan?
Have all endorsements been created correctly?
Was the WIP issued correctly? Was coding in ENTR completed correctly?

When the processor took control of the case, was it handled in an appropriate amount of time?
Were the appropriate referrals made to the underwriter?
Was the correct COI template used?
Were the names and addresses of the certificate holder, named insured, and broker entered correctly?
Were the operations and location described correctly?
Were all appropriate coverages and limits entered correctly?
Was the policy number and expiry date entered correctly?
Was the appropriate cancellation notice provided?
Was the certificate dated correctly?
Were all additional interests/lessors/lienholders correctly described?
Was the certificate of insurance uploaded correctly to SharePoint (using proper naming conventions)?
Was the certificate of insurance emailed to the broker as a PDF?
Was appropriate full documentation added describing the COI?
Were underwriter/broker instructions acted on correctly?
Was the transaction within the user’s authority? If not, were appropriate approvals obtained?
When the processor took control of the case, was it handled in an appropriate amount of time?
Were open policy changes with effective dates prior to cancellation processed before the cancellation?

Were appropriate referrals made to the underwriter (requests to cancel accounts over $10k, requests to backdate cancellation, requests for pro-rata cancellation when not warranted, requests for flat cancellation more than 30 days after renewal, requests for cancellation effective the same date as date of loss on a claim)?
Was appropriate documentation received prior to processing the cancellation (signed LPV, returned policy documents, notification from CAC)?
Was the appropriate method of cancellation applied (short-rate, pro-rata, flat)?
Was the WIP issued correctly? Was coding in ENTR completed correctly?
For cancellations for non-payment, was the cancellation template filled out correctly and returned to CAC?
Was documentation uploaded correctly to SharePoint (using the proper naming conventions)?
Was the correct documentation sent to the broker (cancellation dec page, advice of return premium, registered letter)?
Were any necessary registered letters sent to lessors and lienholders?
Were prints ordered appropriately?
Was the case sent to document delivery using the correct document generation status?
Were underwriter/broker instructions acted on correctly?
Was the transaction within the user’s authority? If not, were appropriate approvals obtained?
When the processor took control of the case, was it handled in an appropriate amount of time?
Was the correct LOE template used?
Was the LOE addressed and dated correctly?
Was the policy information entered correctly (correct policy number, named insured/driver, and effective/expiry dates)?
Were all losses entered correctly?
Was the LOE uploaded correctly to SharePoint (using proper naming conventions)?
Was the LOE emailed to the broker as a PDF?
Was appropriate full documentation added describing the transaction?
Were broker/underwriter instructions acted on correctly?
Was the transaction within the user’s authority? If not, were appropriate approvals obtained?
When the processor took control of the case, was it handled in an appropriate amount of time?
Were related policy change cases processed in their respective order of effective date?
Was the proper documentation obtained for broker transfer (LOA on client letterhead/signed by insured)?
Were notification letters sent to the existing and newly appointed brokers with seven days’ notice provided?

If the existing broker replied with a letter (on client letterhead/signed by insured) agreeing to remain with existing broker, was the case not-processed/new underwriter advised/documentation noted in PAS?
If no reply received in seven days, was a ticket submitted to have IT update the broker code in PAS/ACRE?
Was a $0 codeblock completed correctly for the broker transfer?
Was the new underwriter advised of the broker transfer?
Was all documentation uploaded correctly to SharePoint (using proper naming conventions)?
Was updated documentation (dec page, vehicle schedule, and liability certificates) sent to document delivery?
Were prints ordered appropriately?
Was the case sent to document delivery using the correct document generation status?
Was appropriate full documentation added describing the transaction?
